title: 506. What Is Sportswashing (and Does It Work)?
description: In ancient Rome, it was bread and circuses. Today, it’s a World Cup, an Olympics, and a new Saudi-backed golf league that’s challenging the P.G.A. Tour. Can a sporting event really repair a country’s reputation — or will it trigger the dreaded Streisand Effect?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
